chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Brandon M Maney was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Brandon M Maney in court with attorney Laura P. Sette.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the report received.  Court unseals documents filed 12/18/2015 and unseals the report filed 12/17/2015.  Court approves the plan submitted by WCS dated 12/17/2015.  Defendant to remain at the residential placement group home, continue with psychiatric services, and take all medications, all conditions as stated in the report.  Court approves the plan.

for conditional release plan (Not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect) signed by Judge Ramirez.
Sentencing hearing at 12-22-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Brandon M Maney in court with attorney Laura P. Sette.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties address if a hearing is necessary on an NGI plea.  Defendant enters a special NGI plea of guilty to count #1 (971.17(3). State is not contesting the reports of the physician.  Court finds the defendant guilty, but not guilty due to mental disease/defect of count #1. Court orders medication should be administered 971.17(3)(D). Court orders department of health services be notified.  Defendant is placed on conditional release for 18 months.  Court schedules hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell in court.   Defendant Brandon M Maney did not appear.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
